On 4/18/02 9:27 AM, "Ives Aerts" <ives+junit@...> wrote:

> I've been using JUnit for a while now and quite like it. Unfortunately
> we'll be using C instead of Java in our next project. I've been
> looking at cUnit, but it seems that it needs glib which we don't have
> on our (embedded) platform. Anyone who knows other alternatives?
> 
> I also wonder about the effectiveness of a 'cUnit'-like framework if
> it can't catch runtime errors (address errors, div by 0, ...) like
> JUnit can.
> 


Michael Feathers, the author of CppUnit, has a smaller, simpler version
called CppUnitLite. I've successfully used it to unit test C code. Works
great!

Email him at mfeathers@... and encourage him to make it
available.


-- 
Robert Koss, Ph.D.     | Training, Mentoring, Contract Development
Senior Consultant      | Object Oriented Design, C++, Java
www.objectmentor.com   | Extreme Programming
subject: Re: [junit] JUnit alternatives for C code
